Class Account

java.lang.Object
  Account

public class Account
extends Object

Account class keep the information of the account of specific customer ID. The information about balance and other function when banking activity is done were using methods specified in the account class.

Version:
0.2
Author:
Budi Selamet Raharjo

Method Detail

deposit

public boolean deposit(double amount)
This method add the deposit amount into balance of the account. The deposit will be added to the current amount of the balance of the account. The deposit amount will be checked for negative number. If the deposit number is negative, the method will return false.

Parameters:
amount, - the amount of deposit

getAcctType

public char getAcctType()
Take the current account type.

Returns:
acctType, saved account type

getBalance

public double getBalance()
Take the current balance.

Returns:
balance, saved balance

getId

public String getId()
Take the id of the current account.

Returns:
id, saved ID

setAcctType

public void setAcctType(char type)
Specifies the account type of the current account.

Parameters:
Type, - type of the account

setBalance

public void setBalance(double amount)
Specified the balance of the account.

Parameters:
amount, - amount of the balance. Specifies the amount of the balance that will be saved.

setID

public void setID(String acctId)
Specifies the ID of the account.

Parameters:
acctId, - the ID of the account

withdraw

public boolean withdraw(double amount)
This method will be used when customer withdraw from the account. The withrawed amount will be checked if the current balance is enough. If the balance is enough, the current balance will be subtracted for the amount of withdraw. Is the balance is not enough, the method will return false.

Parameters:
amount, - the amount of withdraw
